cards.name: Zealous Persecution
cards.text: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and creatures your opponents control get -1/-1.
cards.flavor:
"Jharic returned from Grixis changed, a haunted look in her eyes. She destroyed them with an unholy glee that made me shudder."
—Knight-Captain Wyhorn
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and creatures your opponents control get -1/-1.

cards.name: Sword of Feast and Famine

rulings.text: You'll untap all lands you control even if the player doesn't discard a card.

cards.name: Lingering Souls
cards.text:
Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.
Flashback {1}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: The murdered inhabitants of Hollowhenge impart to the living the terror they felt in death.
cards.originalText:
Put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
Flashback {1}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Spectral Procession
cards.text: Create three 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.
cards.flavor:
"I need never remember my past associates, my victims, my mistakes. Innistrad preserves them all for me."
—Sorin Markov

rulings.text: If an effect reduces the cost to cast a spell by an amount of generic mana, it applies to a monocolored hybrid spell only if you've chosen a method of paying for it that includes generic mana.

A card with a monocolored hybrid mana symbol in its mana cost is each of the colors that appears in its mana cost, regardless of what mana was spent to cast it. Thus, Spectral Procession is white even if you spend six blue mana to cast it.

A card with monocolored hybrid mana symbols in its mana cost has a converted mana cost equal to the highest possible cost it could be cast for. Its converted mana cost never changes. Thus, Spectral Procession has a converted mana cost of 6, even if you spend {W}{W}{W} to cast it.

If a cost includes more than one monocolored hybrid mana symbol, you can choose a different way to pay for each symbol. For example, you can pay for Spectral Procession by spending {W}{W}{W}, {2}{W}{W}, {4}{W}, or {6}.

cards.originalText: Put three 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Elspeth, Knight-Errant
cards.text:
+1: Create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.
+1: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn.
−8: You get an emblem with "Artifacts, creatures, enchantments, and lands you control have indestructible."

rulings.text: Emblems behave similarly to enchantments: They have an ability that, in a general sense, continually affects the game. The primary difference between them is that emblems aren't permanents and don't exist on the battlefield. Nothing in the game can remove an emblem, simply because no other spell or ability references them. Once you get an emblem, you keep it for the rest of the game. Emblems have no color, name, card type, or other characteristics beyond the listed ability.

Lethal damage and effects that say "destroy" won't cause a permanent with indestructible to be put into the graveyard. However, a permanent with indestructible can be put into the graveyard for a number of reasons. The most likely reasons are if it's sacrificed, if it's a creature whose toughness is 0 or less, or if it's an Aura that's either unattached or attached to something illegal.

cards.originalText:
+1: Put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield.
+1: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn.
-8: You get an emblem with "Artifacts, creatures, enchantments, and lands you control have indestructible."

cards.name: Caves of Koilos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {W} or {B}. Caves of Koilos deals 1 damage to you.

rulings.text: The damage dealt to you is part of the second mana ability. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.
Like most lands, each land in this cycle is colorless. The damage dealt to you is dealt by a colorless source.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool. Caves of Koilos deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: City of Brass
cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor:
"There is much to learn here, but few can endure the ringing of the spires."
—Nulakam the Archivist

rulings.text: The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, City of Brass's triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. City of Brass's ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.

cards.originalText:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Isolated Chapel
cards.text:
Isolated Chapel enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Plains or a Swamp.
{T}: Add {W} or {B}.
cards.flavor: Not every church is a place of faith.
cards.originalText:
Isolated Chapel enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Plains or a Swamp.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Vault of the Archangel
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}{W}{B}, {T}: Creatures you control gain deathtouch and lifelink until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"For centuries my creation kept this world in balance. Now only her shadow remains."
—Sorin Markov

rulings.text: Vault of the Archangel's last ability affects only creatures you control when that ability resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.
Multiple instances of deathtouch or lifelink on the same creature are redundant.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}{W}{B}, {T}: Creatures you control gain deathtouch and lifelink until end of turn.

cards.name: Windbrisk Heights
cards.text:
Hideaway (This land enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {W}.
{W}, {T}: You may play the exiled card without paying its mana cost if you attacked with three or more creatures this turn.

rulings.text: At the time the ability resolves, you'll get to play the card if you declared three different creatures as attackers at any point in the turn. A creature declared as an attacker in two different attack phases counts only once. A creature that entered the battlefield attacking (such as a token created by Militia's Pride) doesn't count because you never attacked with it.

cards.originalText:
Hideaway (This land enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{W}, {T}: You may play the exiled card without paying its mana cost if you attacked with three or more creatures this turn.

cards.name: Plains
cards.originalText: W

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: B

cards.name: Relic of Progenitus
cards.text:
{T}: Target player exiles a card from their graveyard.
{1}, Exile Relic of Progenitus: Exile all cards from all graveyards. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Elves believe the hydra-god Progenitus sleeps beneath Naya, feeding on forgotten magics.

rulings.text: If you activate Relic of Progenitus's first ability, the targeted player chooses which card to exile. The choice is made as the ability resolves.
You can activate Relic of Progenitus's second ability even if no players have any cards in their graveyards. You'll still draw a card.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her graveyard.
{1}, Exile Relic of Progenitus: Exile all cards from all graveyards. Draw a card.

cards.name: Burrenton Forge-Tender
cards.text:
Protection from red
Sacrifice Burrenton Forge-Tender: Prevent all damage a red source of your choice would deal this turn.
cards.flavor: "We are a clachan of smiths. The forge is as comfortable to us as a small fire during a cool winter's evening."

rulings.text: If the red source you chose changes colors before it deals damage, the damage-prevention effect doesn't apply.
The last ability of Burrenton Forge-Tender doesn't target anything. You choose a source of damage as the ability resolves, if able. You can activate it even if there is no source to choose.

If a permanent spell is chosen as the source of damage, Burrenton Forge-Tender's prevention effect continues to apply for the rest of the turn to the permanent that spell becomes once it has entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Protection from red
Sacrifice Burrenton Forge-Tender: Prevent all damage a red source of your choice would deal this turn.

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"It hurts more if you think about it."
—Hooks, Cabal torturer
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Kataki, War's Wage
cards.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {1}."
cards.flavor:
"Before the war, we prayed to Kataki to sharpen our swords and harden our armor. Without his blessing our weapons are all but useless against the kami hordes."
—Kenzo the Hardhearted
cards.originalText: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {1}."

cards.name: Dismember
cards.text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"You serve Phyrexia. Your pieces would better serve Phyrexia elsewhere."
—Azax-Azog, the Demon Thane

rulings.text: A card with Phyrexian mana symbols in its mana cost is each color that appears in that mana cost, regardless of how that cost may have been paid.
To calculate the converted mana cost of a card with Phyrexian mana symbols in its cost, count each Phyrexian mana symbol as 1.

As you cast a spell or activate an activated ability with one or more Phyrexian mana symbols in its cost, you choose how to pay for each Phyrexian mana symbol at the same time you would choose modes or choose a value for X.
If you're at 1 life or less, you can't pay 2 life.
Phyrexian mana is not a new color. Players can't add Phyrexian mana to their mana pools.

cards.originalText:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ghost Quarter
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Ghost Quarter: Destroy target land. Its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle their library.
cards.flavor: Deserted, but not uninhabited.

rulings.text: If you target Ghost Quarter with its own ability, the ability won't resolve because its target is no longer on the battlefield. You won't get to search for a land card.

If the targeted land is an illegal target by the time Ghost Quarter's ability resolves, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. The land's controller won't get to search for a basic land card.

The target land's controller gets to search for a basic land card even if that land wasn't destroyed by Ghost Quarter's ability. This may happen because the land has indestructible or because it was regenerated.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ghost Quarter: Destroy target land. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle his or her library.

cards.name: Accorder Paladin
cards.text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: "I fight for the suns, the surface, and everything in between."
cards.originalText: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Ardent Recruit
cards.text: Metalcraft — Ardent Recruit gets +2/+2 as long as you control three or more artifacts.
cards.flavor: "We lost our homes and our kin. We won't let those rotters take our future as well."
cards.originalText: Metalcraft — Ardent Recruit gets +2/+2 as long as you control three or more artifacts.

cards.name: Banishment Decree
cards.text: Put target artifact, creature, or enchantment on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"Unworthy of consecration."
—Axsh, lesser cenobite
cards.originalText: Put target artifact, creature, or enchantment on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Choking Fumes
cards.text: Put a -1/-1 counter on each attacking creature.
cards.flavor:
"Fall to your knees and welcome our embrace."
—Qal-Sha, Priest of Norn
cards.originalText: Put a -1/-1 counter on each attacking creature.

cards.name: Divine Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"The Phyrexians are vulnerable. Do not despair. We will prevail!"
—Juryan, rebel leader

rulings.text: If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, you do not gain any life.
If Divine Offering resolves, but the artifact regenerates or has indestructible, you'll still gain the life.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Frantic Salvage
cards.text:
Put any number of target artifact cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "We will mourn when there is time. For now, we survive."

rulings.text: You choose the order of the cards you put on top of your library.

You can cast this with zero targets. If you do, you'll get to draw a card. However, if you cast this with at least one target and all of those targets become illegal (because another effect has removed them from the graveyard, perhaps), the spell won't resolve and you won't get to draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Put any number of target artifact cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Gore Vassal
cards.text: Sacrifice Gore Vassal: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. Then if that creature's toughness is 1 or greater, regenerate it.
cards.flavor:
"Rid them of their unfaithful organs. Bring new hearts to the unbelievers."
—Tome of Machines, verse 1703

rulings.text: You can activate Gore Vassal's ability targeting itself, but it won't get a -1/-1 counter or regenerate because it'll be an illegal target when the ability resolves.
The regeneration shield will last until the turn ends or until it's used.

Let's say you activate Gore Vassal's ability targeting a creature with 3 toughness and 2 damage marked on it. The regeneration shield will be created just before the creature is destroyed for having damage marked on it equal to or greater than its toughness. The creature will then regenerate. That is, all damage will be removed from it and it will become tapped; any counters on the creature, including the -1/-1 counter put on by this ability, remain.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Gore Vassal: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. Then if that creature's toughness is 1 or greater, regenerate it.

cards.name: Hero of Bladehold
cards.text:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Hero of Bladehold attacks, create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens that are tapped and attacking.

rulings.text: Whenever Hero of Bladehold attacks, both abilities will trigger. You can put them onto the stack in any order. If the token-creating ability resolves first, the tokens each get +1/+0 until end of turn from the battle cry ability.
You choose which opponent or planeswalker an opponent controls that each token is attacking when it is put onto the battlefield.
Although the tokens are attacking, they never were declared as attacking creatures (for purposes of abilities that trigger whenever a creature attacks, for example).

cards.originalText:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Hero of Bladehold attacks, put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield tapped and attacking.

cards.name: Kemba's Legion
cards.text:
Vigilance
Kemba's Legion can block an additional creature each combat for each Equipment attached to Kemba's Legion.
cards.flavor: The squabble over succession was quickly replaced by the struggle to survive.

rulings.text: The number of creatures Kemba's Legion can block is calculated when blocking creatures are declared. Take into account the number of Equipment attached to Kemba's Legion at that time, as well as any other effects that increase the number of creatures Kemba's Legion can block.

cards.originalText:
Vigilance
Kemba's Legion can block an additional creature for each Equipment attached to Kemba's Legion.

cards.name: Leonin Relic-Warder
cards.text:
When Leonin Relic-Warder enters the battlefield, you may exile target artifact or enchantment.
When Leonin Relic-Warder leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

rulings.text: If Leonin Relic-Warder leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and when it resolves, do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted artifact or enchantment with no way to return it to the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
When Leonin Relic-Warder enters the battlefield, you may exile target artifact or enchantment.
When Leonin Relic-Warder leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.text: Create two 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature tokens.
cards.flavor: The need to obey was inscribed on every plate in their bodies.
cards.originalText: Put two 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Mirran Crusader
cards.text: Double strike, protection from black and from green
cards.flavor: A symbol of what Mirrodin once was and hope for what it will be again.
cards.originalText: Double strike, protection from black and from green

cards.name: Phyrexian Rebirth
cards.text: Destroy all creatures, then create an X/X colorless Horror artifact creature token, where X is the number of creatures destroyed this way.
cards.flavor: As long as one drop of the oil exists, the joyous work continues.

rulings.text: Any triggered abilities that trigger because a creature was destroyed won't be put onto the stack until after Phyrexian Rebirth finishes resolving. This means the Horror creature token can be targeted by those abilities, if applicable.
If a creature regenerates or has indestructible, it won't be counted when determining the value of X.

foreignNames.name: ファイレクシアの再誕

cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures, then put an X/X colorless Horror artifact creature token onto the battlefield, where X is the number of creatures destroyed this way.

Vigilance
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
cards.flavor:
"May our blessings sever the tongues of the forsaken."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
cards.originalText:
Vigilance
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.name: Tine Shrike
cards.text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
cards.flavor: A new bird of prey—one that hunts sentience.

Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.name: Victory's Herald
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Victory's Herald attacks, attacking creatures gain flying and lifelink until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The corruption stirred the heavens above, awaking a shining champion.

rulings.text: Even though the triggered ability affects only attacking creatures, the bonuses will remain for the rest of the turn.
Victory's Herald also gains flying (which will likely be redundant) and lifelink if it's still attacking when the ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Victory's Herald attacks, attacking creatures gain flying and lifelink until end of turn.

cards.name: White Sun's Zenith
cards.text: Create X 2/2 white Cat creature tokens. Shuffle White Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: After the Battle of Liet Field, the white sun crested above Taj-Nar, bringing hope to all who survived the carnage.

rulings.text: If this spell doesn't resolve, none of its effects occur. In particular, it will go to the graveyard rather than to its owner's library.

cards.originalText: Put X 2/2 white Cat creature tokens onto the battlefield. Shuffle White Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.

cards.name: Blue Sun's Zenith
cards.text: Target player draws X cards. Shuffle Blue Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"The Origin Query will wait. We must ensure we survive to return to it."
—Pelyus, vedalken ordinar

rulings.text: If this spell doesn't resolve, none of its effects occur. In particular, it will go to the graveyard rather than to its owner's library.
Because you follow the spell's instructions in order, you won't be able to draw the same Blue Sun's Zenith that you cast.

cards.originalText: Target player draws X cards. Shuffle Blue Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.

cards.name: Consecrated Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may draw two cards.
cards.flavor: Blessed by the hands of Jin-Gitaxias.

rulings.text: You may either draw two cards or not draw at all. You can't choose to draw only one card.
The ability triggers once for each card an opponent draws. You choose whether to draw two cards as each of those abilities resolves.
If each player controls a Consecrated Sphinx, their abilities will cause each other to trigger until one player chooses not to draw cards.

foreignNames.name: 聖別されたスフィンクス

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may draw two cards.

cards.name: Corrupted Conscience
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
cards.flavor: Karn's creation is now his master.

rulings.text: Multiple instances of infect on the same creature are redundant.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.name: Cryptoplasm
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Cryptoplasm become a copy of another target creature. If you do, Cryptoplasm gains this ability.
cards.flavor:
"If left in the enemy's shape too long, it might be lost to them."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent

rulings.text: You choose the target for the triggered ability when the ability is put onto the stack. You choose whether or not Cryptoplasm becomes a copy of that creature when the ability resolves.
The copy effect lasts indefinitely. Often, it will last until it is overwritten by another copy effect (if it copies another creature on a future turn, perhaps.)
If the creature is an illegal target when the ability tries to resolve, it won't resolve. Cryptoplasm won't become a copy of that creature; it remains whatever it was before.
If another creature becomes a copy of Cryptoplasm, it will become a copy of whatever Cryptoplasm is currently copying (if anything), plus it will have Cryptoplasm's triggered ability.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Cryptoplasm become a copy of another target creature. If you do, Cryptoplasm gains this ability.

cards.name: Distant Memories
cards.text: Search your library for a card, exile it, then shuffle your library. Any opponent may have you put that card into your hand. If no player does, you draw three cards.
cards.flavor:
"The fleeting shadows of his primitive self have all but vanished."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

rulings.text: The card is exiled face up. Each opponent will know what the card is when deciding whether to have you put it in your hand.
If no opponent has you put the card into your hand, the card remains exiled.
In multiplayer formats, your opponents each make the decision in turn order.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a card, exile it, then shuffle your library. Any opponent may have you put that card into your hand. If no player does, you draw three cards.

cards.name: Fuel for the Cause
cards.text: Counter target spell, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
cards.flavor: "Your ideas will be discarded and your will repurposed."

rulings.text: You must be able to target another spell in order to cast Fuel for the Cause. You can't just cast it in order to proliferate, and it can't target itself.
If the spell is an illegal target when Fuel for the Cause tries to resolve, it won't resolve. You won't proliferate.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

cards.name: Mirran Spy
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may untap target creature.
cards.flavor: Accurate information is a precious commodity in times of war.

foreignNames.name: ミラディン人のスパイ

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may untap target creature.

cards.name: Mitotic Manipulation
cards.text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put one of those cards onto the battlefield if it has the same name as a permanent. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"They can't even comprehend nature. How could they improve it?"
—Venser

rulings.text: "The same name as a permanent" means the same name as a permanent currently on the battlefield as Mitotic Manipulation resolves.
No matter how many of the seven cards have the same name as a permanent, you can put only one of them onto the battlefield.
You don't reveal any of the other cards or the order in which they go to the bottom of your library.

cards.originalText: Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put one of those cards onto the battlefield if it has the same name as a permanent. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Neurok Commando
cards.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever Neurok Commando deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: "There's no more time for secluded study. Answers are there only for those with the courage to take them."

rulings.text: Only one card is drawn no matter how much combat damage was dealt.

cards.originalText:
Shroud
Whenever Neurok Commando deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Oculus
cards.text: When Oculus dies, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"In its gaze I saw no mercy, no recognition that I was worthy to exist."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent
cards.originalText: When Oculus is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Quicksilver Geyser
cards.text: Return up to two target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor:
"Phyrexians are tenacious. That's not the same thing as clever."
—Tezzeret
cards.originalText: Return up to two target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Serum Raker
cards.text:
Flying
When Serum Raker dies, each player discards a card.
cards.flavor: The serum from the blinkmoths they gather greases the joints of witch engines.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Serum Raker is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, each player discards a card.

cards.name: Spire Serpent
cards.text:
Defender
Metalcraft — As long as you control three or more artifacts, Spire Serpent gets +2/+2 and can attack as though it didn't have defender.
cards.flavor: A mirror to draw its eye, a rod to rouse its rage, and a sword to break its bonds.

rulings.text: Spire Serpent still has defender if you control three or more artifacts, although it will be able to attack.
If Spire Serpent has been declared as an attacker, and you stop controlling three or more artifacts later in combat, Spire Serpent continues being an attacking creature until combat ends.

cards.originalText:
Defender
Metalcraft — As long as you control three or more artifacts, Spire Serpent gets +2/+2 and can attack as though it didn't have defender.

cards.name: Steel Sabotage
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target artifact spell.
• Return target artifact to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"You are hopelessly obsolete, my brothers. Come and join the Great Work."
—Rhmir, Hand of the Augur

rulings.text: An artifact spell exists only on the stack. An artifact exists only on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Choose one — Counter target artifact spell; or return target artifact to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Treasure Mage
cards.text: When Treasure Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: If a card in your library has X in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.

cards.originalText: When Treasure Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Turn the Tide
cards.text: Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Let their mindless armies come and face the might of genius."
—Varil, Neurok partisan

rulings.text: Only creatures your opponents control when Turn the Tide resolves are affected. Creatures that enter the battlefield later in the turn are not.

foreignNames.name: Changer le cours de la guerre

cards.originalText: Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Vedalken Anatomist
cards.text: {2}{U}, {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. You may tap or untap that creature.
cards.flavor: "Specimen 211 examination report. Observation: graft sublimation incomplete. Result: death. Prepare specimen 212."

rulings.text: If the creature is an illegal target when the ability tries to resolve, it won't resolve. None of its effects happen.

foreignNames.name: ヴィダルケンの解剖学者

cards.originalText: {2}{U}, {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. You may tap or untap that creature.

cards.name: Vedalken Infuser
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on target artifact.
cards.flavor: "All plans begin as dreams. I intend to awaken them."

rulings.text: You may target and put a charge counter on any artifact, even if it doesn't have an ability that references charge counters.

foreignNames.name: ヴェイダルケンの注入者

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on target artifact.

cards.name: Vivisection
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Draw three cards.
cards.flavor: Phyrexians research with the grace of surgeons and the finesse of butchers.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Vivisection, sacrifice a creature.
Draw three cards.

cards.name: Black Sun's Zenith
cards.text: Put X -1/-1 counters on each creature. Shuffle Black Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"Under the suns, Mirrodin kneels and begs us for perfection."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault

rulings.text: If this spell doesn't resolve, none of its effects occur. In particular, it will go to the graveyard rather than to its owner's library.

cards.originalText: Put X -1/-1 counters on each creature. Shuffle Black Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.

cards.name: Caustic Hound
cards.text: When Caustic Hound dies, each player loses 4 life.
cards.flavor: At first, the Mirrans aimed for its exposed gut. The survivors quickly learned to do otherwise.
cards.originalText: When Caustic Hound is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, each player loses 4 life.

cards.name: Flensermite
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.originalText:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Flesh-Eater Imp
cards.text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Sacrifice a creature: Flesh-Eater Imp gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Sacrifice a creature: Flesh-Eater Imp gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Go for the Throat
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact creature.
cards.flavor: Having flesh is increasingly a liability on Mirrodin.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is also an artifact when Go for the Throat tries to resolve, it won't resolve.

cards.originalText: Destroy target nonartifact creature.

cards.name: Gruesome Encore
cards.text: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step. If that creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else.
cards.originalText: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step. If that creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else.

cards.name: Horrifying Revelation
cards.text: Target player discards a card, then puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Ours is a glorious transmission! Behold a future where all bow to the Father of Machines."
—Isila, Priest of Sheoldred

rulings.text: If the player has no cards in their hand or no cards in their library, the other effect still happens.

cards.originalText: Target player discards a card, then puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Massacre Wurm
cards.text:
When Massacre Wurm enters the battlefield, creatures your opponents control get -2/-2 until end of turn.
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, that player loses 2 life.

rulings.text: If an opponent controls a creature you own, that opponent will lose 2 life when that creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield.
If a creature an opponent controls is put into the graveyard from the battlefield at the same time as Massacre Wurm, its last ability will trigger.

cards.originalText:
When Massacre Wurm enters the battlefield, creatures your opponents control get -2/-2 until end of turn.
Whenever a creature an opponent controls is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, that player loses 2 life.

cards.name: Morbid Plunder
cards.text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Even the dead are raw materials for the Phyrexian vision of perfection.
cards.originalText: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Nested Ghoul
cards.text: Whenever a source deals damage to Nested Ghoul, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor:
"The chest cavity is cleared of useless meat. I know just what to do with the space."
—Gyed, Vault Priest

rulings.text: If multiple sources deal damage to Nested Ghoul simultaneously (because it was blocked by multiple creatures, for example), the ability will trigger for each source dealing damage to Nested Ghoul.
Nested Ghoul's ability will trigger if a source with infect deals damage to it.

cards.originalText: Whenever a source deals damage to Nested Ghoul, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Phyresis
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
cards.flavor:
"Perfection is at hand. You have been freed of weakness and made compleat."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

rulings.text: Multiple instances of infect on the same creature are redundant.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.name: Phyrexian Crusader
cards.text:
First strike, protection from red and from white
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

rulings.text: If Phyrexian Crusader blocks or is blocked by a creature without first strike or double strike, the damage dealt by Phyrexian Crusader results in -1/-1 counters that will affect how much damage the other creature assigns (if it's still on the battlefield).

foreignNames.name: ファイレクシアの十字軍

cards.originalText:
First strike, protection from red and from white
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.name: Phyrexian Rager
cards.text: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"I believe many worlds will bow to Phyrexia. Mirrodin is merely the first."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

foreignNames.name: ファイレクシアの憤怒鬼

cards.originalText: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Phyrexian Vatmother
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you get a poison counter.

foreignNames.name: ファイレクシアの槽母

cards.originalText:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you get a poison counter.

cards.name: Sangromancer
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may gain 3 life.
Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may gain 3 life.

rulings.text: If one or more creatures an opponent controls are put into the graveyard at the same time as Sangromancer, Sangromancer's first ability will trigger that many times.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature an opponent controls is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may gain 3 life.
Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may gain 3 life.

cards.name: Scourge Servant
cards.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
cards.flavor:
"The union of the oil and necrogen has produced many pleasing reactions."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One
cards.originalText: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.name: Septic Rats
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Whenever Septic Rats attacks, if defending player is poisoned, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A player is poisoned if that player has one or more poison counters.
Septic Rats gets a maximum of +1/+1 from its ability, no matter how many poison counters the defending player has.

cards.originalText:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Whenever Septic Rats attacks, if defending player is poisoned, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Spread the Sickness
cards.text: Destroy target creature, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
cards.flavor: Life is ephemeral. Phyrexia is eternal.

rulings.text: If the creature is an illegal target when Spread the Sickness tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve. You won't proliferate.
If the creature regenerates or has indestructible when Spread the Sickness resolves, you'll still proliferate.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

cards.name: Virulent Wound
cards.text: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. When that creature dies this turn, its controller gets a poison counter.
cards.flavor: Sadly, the extent of Gerkk's healing knowledge was "don't pick at it."

rulings.text: If the creature is not put into a graveyard on the turn Virulent Wound resolves, its controller won't get a poison counter.

cards.originalText: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. When that creature is put into a graveyard this turn, its controller gets a poison counter.

cards.name: Blisterstick Shaman
cards.text: When Blisterstick Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: A productive warren requires a good deal of prodding.

foreignNames.name: 火膨れ杖のシャーマン

cards.originalText: When Blisterstick Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Burn the Impure
cards.text: Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature has infect, Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.
cards.flavor: Flame doesn't kneel to Phyrexia.

rulings.text: If the creature is an illegal target when Burn the Impure resolves, the spell won't resolve and none of its effects will happen, even if that creature has infect.

cards.originalText: Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature has infect, Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Concussive Bolt
cards.text:
Concussive Bolt deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, creatures controlled by that player or by that planeswalker's controller can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: Shock one, awe the rest.

rulings.text: The number of artifacts you control is checked only once: when Concussive Bolt resolves. If you don't control three or more artifacts at that time, creatures will be able to block that turn, even if you gain control of more artifacts later in the turn.
If the player is an illegal target when Concussive Bolt resolves, the spell won't resolve. None of its effects will happen, even if you control three or more artifacts.

If you controlled three or more artifacts as Concussive Bolt resolved, the targeted player won't be able to block with any creatures this turn. That is, the set of affected creatures isn't locked in as the spell resolves.

cards.originalText:
Concussive Bolt deals 4 damage to target player.
Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, creatures that player controls can't block this turn.

cards.name: Crush
cards.text: Destroy target noncreature artifact.
cards.flavor: A golem's hands know no tenderness.

rulings.text: If the targeted artifact is also a creature when Crush tries to resolve, it won't resolve.

cards.originalText: Destroy target noncreature artifact.

cards.name: Galvanoth
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it's an instant or sorcery card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.
cards.flavor: It chews open Mirrodin's husk and feeds on the outpouring of energy.

rulings.text: If the card you look at isn't an instant or sorcery card, it remains on top of your library. You don't reveal it.
You may pay additional costs, such as kicker costs, of the instant or sorcery card.
If the card has any mandatory additional costs, as Kuldotha Rebirth does, you must pay them in order to cast the spell.
If the card has an X in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as its value.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it's an instant or sorcery card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Gnathosaur
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Gnathosaur gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Mirran creatures that could withstand the Phyrexian oil found an abundance of crunchy snacks.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice an artifact: Gnathosaur gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Wardriver
cards.text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor:
"A true warrior fights with whatever's handy."
—Qerk of the Secret Warren
cards.originalText: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Hellkite Igniter
cards.text:
Flying, haste
{1}{R}: Hellkite Igniter gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of artifacts you control.
cards.flavor: Its flight sets the sky itself on fire.

rulings.text: The number of artifacts you control is counted when the ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying, haste
{1}{R}: Hellkite Igniter gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of artifacts you control.

cards.name: Hero of Oxid Ridge
cards.text:
Haste
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Hero of Oxid Ridge attacks, creatures with power 1 or less can't block this turn.

rulings.text: The power of each creature is checked only when blocking creatures are declared. If a creature has power 1 or less at that time, it can't block, even if its power was greater than 1 when the last ability resolved.
Creatures with power 1 or less can't block even if they weren't on the battlefield when the last ability resolved.

cards.originalText:
Haste
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Hero of Oxid Ridge attacks, creatures with power 1 or less can't block this turn.

cards.name: Into the Core
cards.text: Exile two target artifacts.
cards.flavor:
"They believe they're driving us back, but we're leading them to their doom."
—Kethek, furnace stoker

rulings.text: You must be able to target two different artifacts in order to cast Into the Core.

cards.originalText: Exile two target artifacts.

cards.name: Koth's Courier
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Koth sent partisans into the Tangle to bring survivors to the safe haven of the tunnels below Kuldotha.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk

cards.name: Kuldotha Flamefiend
cards.text: When Kuldotha Flamefiend enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you do, Kuldotha Flamefiend deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.

rulings.text: Kuldotha Flamefiend's ability may target up to four creatures and/or players. Each must be chosen to receive at least 1 damage.

You choose the target(s) and how the damage will be divided when you put the triggered ability on the stack. You don't choose whether to sacrifice an artifact or which artifact you're sacrificing until the ability resolves. Once you decide to sacrifice an artifact (or not), it's too late for players to respond.

cards.originalText: When Kuldotha Flamefiend enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you do, Kuldotha Flamefiend deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Kuldotha Ringleader
cards.text:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Kuldotha Ringleader attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor: Being surrounded by goblins is less objectionable when they're fighting for you.
cards.originalText:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Kuldotha Ringleader attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Metallic Mastery
cards.text: Gain control of target artifact until end of turn. Untap that artifact. It gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"All will be reforged in the fires of glory."
—Urabrask the Hidden
cards.originalText: Gain control of target artifact until end of turn. Untap that artifact. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Ogre Resister
cards.flavor: He didn't have a word for "home," but he knew it was something to be defended.

cards.name: Rally the Forces
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Drive them back! Make their underworld into their grave!"
—Koth of the Hammer

rulings.text: Even though Rally the Forces affects only attacking creatures, the bonus will remain for the rest of the turn.
If Rally the Forces is cast before attackers are declared or after combat ends, it won't do anything.

cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Red Sun's Zenith
cards.text: Red Sun's Zenith deals X damage to any target. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead. Shuffle Red Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.

rulings.text: If this spell doesn't resolve, none of its effects occur. In particular, it will go to the graveyard rather than to its owner's library.

cards.originalText: Red Sun's Zenith deals X damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would be put into a graveyard this turn, exile it instead. Shuffle Red Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.

cards.name: Slagstorm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each creature.
• Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each player.
cards.flavor:
"As long as we have the will to fight, we are never without weapons."
—Koth of the Hammer
cards.originalText: Choose one — Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each creature; or Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each player.

cards.name: Spiraling Duelist
cards.text: Metalcraft — Spiraling Duelist has double strike as long as you control three or more artifacts.
cards.flavor: "I never move the same way twice. Those rotters can't grasp chaos."

rulings.text: If Spiraling Duelist has double strike as the combat damage step begins, there will be a second combat damage step. As that second combat damage step begins, if Spiraling Duelist no longer has double strike (perhaps because an artifact creature you controlled was destroyed), Spiraling Duelist will not assign combat damage a second time.

cards.originalText: Metalcraft — Spiraling Duelist has double strike as long as you control three or more artifacts.

cards.name: Blightwidow
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
cards.originalText:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.name: Creeping Corrosion
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts.
cards.flavor:
"We will reveal the futility of their heresy by showing them how fragile their relics are."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger
cards.originalText: Destroy all artifacts.

cards.name: Fangren Marauder
cards.text: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may gain 5 life.
cards.flavor:
"The fangren fight without comfort of any kind. We can ask no less of ourselves."
—Tilien, Sylvok partisan

rulings.text: If Fangren Marauder has itself become an artifact for some reason, you'll gain 5 life when it is put into a graveyard from the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may gain 5 life.

cards.name: Glissa's Courier
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor:
"So, the survivors from Oxid Ridge are on the move. Let them come and witness predation in its purest form."
—Glissa
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk

cards.name: Green Sun's Zenith
cards.text: Search your library for a green creature card with converted mana cost X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. Shuffle Green Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: As the green sun crowned, Phyrexian prophecies glowed on the Tree of Tales.

rulings.text: If this spell doesn't resolve, none of its effects occur. In particular, it will go to the graveyard rather than to its owner's library.
If Green Sun's Zenith is countered, none of its effects will happen. Notably, it will be put into its owner's graveyard rather than shuffled into its owner's library.

In most cases, if you own Green Sun's Zenith and cast it, you'll shuffle your library twice. In practice, shuffling once is sufficient, but effects that care about you shuffling your library (like Psychogenic Probe, for example) will see that you've shuffled twice.

If you own Green Sun's Zenith, but an opponent casts it (due to Knowledge Pool's effect, for example), that opponent searches their library for an appropriate creature card, then shuffles that library. That opponent then shuffles Green Sun's Zenith into your library. You won't shuffle any library in this case.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a green creature card with converted mana cost X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. Shuffle Green Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.

cards.name: Lead the Stampede
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal any number of creature cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal any number of creature cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
